article.para: You don’t need to be an electronics buff or mechanical engineer in order to build your own 3D printer. If you can screw a nut on a bolt you can build this printer.
You also don’t need to invest large amounts of money in either parts or tools. The RepRap has been designed around commonly available parts and using commonly available tools.

section.title: Mechanical build
section.para: For the mechanical build you will need these tools and the associated skills.

listitem.para: Open end wrenches: M8, M4 and M3
Hex keys if you’ve bought those kinds of screws

section.title: Digital caliper
section.para: You can't build a RepRap and make it work without a digital caliper. If you have a normal caliper put it to the side and order a digital caliper. The digital caliper gives a readout of two significant digits after the comma. The digital caliper is required while calibrating your frame and later when calibrating your axes. You can find reliable digital calipers on Amazon for $10 or €10.
There are two important tidbits to remember about digital calipers:

listitem.para: When storing away your digital caliper always remove the battery. These devices never really shut down.

Whenever you make a measurement always first reset your caliper to zero, even when it already says 00,0. If you make measurement without resetting the caliper to zero you might get inaccurate readings.

section.para: Despite these two small annoyances digital calipers outperform regular calipers in such a way that you can't build a RepRap printer without them.

section.para: A spirit level is used during frame building, axes building and general calibration of your printer. A smaller spirit level is better than a bigger:

section.title: Plumb line
section.para: You need a plumb line a one point only during the build: when the Z-axis smooth rods are installed. You can also hang a nut on a string but a plumb line will work much better.

section.title: Installation of Z-axis bushings
section.para: Depending on which kinds of bushings you're using you need different kinds of tools. There a there really two categories:

listitem.para: Seperate bushings like PLA bushings or printed bushing holders for brass bushings

Bushings integrated into the printed parts. This is generally referred to as the Prusa felt branch. This is actually a counter-intuitive name. The designer of the RepRap Prusa Mendel printer - Josef Prusa - created a branch with bushing holders integrated in the printed parts. The original purpose was to glue small pieces of felt into these holders (felt was then used as a bushing.) It is also possible to mount brass bushings in these holder. Later on the parts for LM8UU bearings were also added to this branch. The use of felt as a bushing never really caught on and is now outdated. The bushing holders integrated into the parts are still popular for use with brass bushings and LM8UU linear bearings.
